key_risks: Profitability challenges and consistent net losses
Dependence on the mobile gaming sector
Intense competition from Unreal Engine and other platforms
Valuation concerns with a high forward P/S ratio
controversies: Pricing model backlash and runtime fee policy controversy
Significant leadership changes and operational restructuring
social_issues: Damage to developer trust due to pricing model changes
Impact of layoffs on employees and company culture
governance_issues: Leadership instability with CFO departure and new CEO appointment

sources.title: Unity Removes Runtime Fee Policy After A Year Of Backlash - TheGamer
sources.snippet: The original policy sought to charge developers for every separate installation of their game, but Unity reworked this change after overwhelming backlash from the developer community. sources.title: Unity scraps its 'Runtime Fee' following developer backlash
sources.snippet: Unity has announced the cancellation of its contentious 'Runtime Fee' for game developers. The decision comes after months of intense criticism from the gaming community. Matt Bromberg, President and CEO of Unity, stated: "After deep consultation with our community, customers, and partners, we've made the decision to cancel the Runtime Fee for our games customers, effective immediately."
